On festival days, or seeing good people, or being praised, or seeing the Dharma that was initially practiced and accomplished,
or seeing others do...such dreams should be known as auspicious;
if the opposite occurs, then they should be abandoned.
If one sees good dreams, one should know that they are accomplished;
if one sees bad signs, one should know that they are not accomplished.
Therefore, one should abandon bad dream signs. According to the superior, middling, and inferior dreams one sees, one will attain accomplishment. One should know this.

Although one sees evil, if one wishes to bring them in, one should use the peaceful mantra to protect the ghee, and recite it a hundred times to remove calamities and obstacles, and then become pure. Out of compassion, one may bring them in as one wishes.
